description.narrative: Jain Irrigation Systems Ltd. (JISL or the Company) is Indias largest provider of micro-irrigation systems (MIS). In addition to MIS, the Company is also a leading producer of plastic sheets and pipes, agro processed products, tissue culture and green energy. Its headquarters are located in Jalgaon in the western Indian state of Maharashtra. IFC is considering financing part of its capital expenditure project with the total cost of about US$257 million.

Raising farmer incomes: The adoption of MIS is expected to result in reduced risk from weather, lower cost of farm inputs and an increase in farm yields due to better utilization of inputs. This is expected to improve farmer income and have a direct impact on poverty reduction. Improved water management: India has 16% of the world''s population and only 4% of the water resources. MIS improves water use efficiency from the average 30-40% in India to 80-85%, leading to improved water management resulting in more sustainable growth for the country. Supporting the development of a modern food processing industry: A very low proportion of fruit and vegetable produce is currently processed in India and growth in processed foods is likely to be constrained by lack of a reliable supply chain. JISL is expected to play a key role in not only supplying some of the inputs but in setting the benchmark for other players that enter the market. Employment: Additional employment is expected in India.
